articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Qatar emir in Iran, calls for regional de-escalation at 'sensitive' time
articles.description: Qatar's ruler, Emir Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad al-Thani, said during a visit to Iran on Sunday that de-escalation and dialogue were needed to resolve regional crises at a "sensitive" time.
articles.content:
DUBAI (Reuters) - Qatar’s ruler, Emir Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad al-Thani, said during a visit to Iran on Sunday that de-escalation and dialogue were needed to resolve regional crises at a “sensitive” time. 
He was speaking in a televised news conference with Ir… [+456 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Iran summons UK envoy over his attendance at 'illegal' rally
articles.description: Iran summoned the UK envoy on Sunday to complain about his attendance at an "illegal" rally in Tehran to commemorate those killed in a Ukrainian airliner mistakingly downed by the country's military forces, Iranian Foreign Ministry's website reported.
articles.content: DUBAI, Jan 12 (Reuters) - Iran summoned the UK envoy on Sunday to complain about his attendance at an “illegal” rally in Tehran to commemorate those killed in a Ukrainian airliner mistakingly downed by the country’s military forces, Iranian Foreign Ministry’s… [+379 chars]

articles.author: Gregory Scruggs
articles.title: As Amazon.com flexes its muscle, Seattle moves to curb corporate political donations
articles.description: Seattle, the Pacific Northwest city where home-grown online retailer Amazon.com has increasingly flexed its political muscle, is expected to approve on Monday legislation banning political contributions by companies with at least 5% foreign ownership.

articles.author: Abdul Qadir Sediqi
articles.title: At least 17 killed as extreme cold sweeps across Afghanistan
articles.description: A severe cold snap killed at least 17 people in Afghanistan on Saturday, government officials said, as heavy snowfall and rain continued to lash parts of the country.
articles.content:
KABUL (Reuters) - A severe cold snap killed at least 17 people in Afghanistan on Saturday, government officials said, as heavy snowfall and rain continued to lash parts of the country. 
Afghanistan is no stranger to extreme winter weather, during which vario… [+1846 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Canadian province reports 'incident' at nuclear power station near Toronto
articles.description: The Canadian province of Ontario on Sunday reported an "incident" at the Pickering nuclear power station near Toronto but said there had been no abnormal release of radioactivity.
articles.content:
OTTAWA (Reuters) - The Canadian province of Ontario on Sunday reported an “incident” at the Pickering nuclear power station near Toronto but said there had been no abnormal release of radioactivity.

articles.author: Rod Nickel
articles.title: Canada's Trudeau to attend Iran crash victim memorial in hard-hit Edmonton
articles.description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is set on Sunday to attend what is expected to be the country's largest memorial to the victims of a Ukrainian airliner shot down in Iran in a disaster that killed 57 Canadians, mainly of Iranian descent.

articles.title: Protests erupt again in Iran after military admits it hit plane
articles.description: Protesters piled pressure on Iran's leadership on Sunday with demands for top authorities to quit after the Iranian military admitted it had mistakenly shot down a Ukrainian airliner at a time when it had feared U.S. strikes.
articles.content:

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Portuguese Goncalves dies after crash in Dakar Rally
articles.description: Portuguese motorcycle rider Paulo Goncalves died after a crash in the seventh stage of the Dakar Rally in Saudi Arabia on Sunday, organisers said.
articles.content:
(Reuters) - Portuguese motorcycle rider Paulo Goncalves died after a crash in the seventh stage of the Dakar Rally in Saudi Arabia on Sunday, organisers said.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Australian Ormsby secures Hong Kong Open title
articles.description: Australian Wade Ormsby completed a wire-to-wire victory at the Hong Kong Open on Sunday as a final-round 66 lifted the Australian to the title for the second time in three years.
articles.content:
BANGKOK (Reuters) - Australian Wade Ormsby completed a wire-to-wire victory at the Hong Kong Open on Sunday as a final-round 66 lifted the Australian to the title for the second time in three years. 
Ormsby went into the final day with a two-shot lead over T… [+1266 chars]

articles.title: Buttler questions use of stump microphones
articles.description: England wicketkeeper Jos Buttler has apologised for his foul-mouthed verbal volley in the second test against South Africa, but questioned whether television viewers should have access to the audio from stump microphones.

articles.description:
A U.S. stock market that has
weathered trade wars, weak corporate earnings, and now a

obstacle: the 2020 U.S. election season.
